page.title: 17BLACKPOOL SEA CADETS
page.content: In the centre of Bispham is the building where the Sea Cadet Corps meet. Boys and girls between the ages of 12 and 18 may join, and work for badges or promotion - they may become officers after they are 18. All kinds of subjects are studied, such as sailing, shooting, signals, camping, canoeing, rowing and stores. Sailing is studied from an elementary level, right up to being qualified as an instructor; canoeing and rowing are taken at different levels and the stores badge is awarded to cadets who look after the equipment.The boys' parade night is held every Tuesday,the girls' night every Thursday, and a joint parade every Friday.There is a small subscription fee. Every Monday the Sea Cadet Band meets to practise, and has a very high reputation at the moment.
